alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 11:29PM CDT until July 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT FOR JEFFERSON...SHAWNEE...NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS...NORTHEASTERN WABAUNSEE...NORTHEASTERN OSAGE AND SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON COUNTIES... At 1128 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Easton to near Perry to 4 miles north of Burlingame, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Lawrence, Valley Falls, Rossville, Oskaloosa, Tecumseh, Richland, Dover, Silver Lake, Auburn, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Hoyt, Ozawkie, Nortonville, Lecompton, Maple Hill, Clinton and Winchester. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 335 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 166 and 205. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
